ZoneÂ¶

struct asmjit::Zone
#include <zone.h>

Fast incremental memory allocator.

Memory allocator designed to allocate small objects that will be invalidated (free) all at once.

Public Functions

ASMJIT_API Zone(size_t chunkSize)

Create a new instance of Zone allocator.

Parameters
  • chunkSize -

    Default size of the first chunk.

ASMJIT_API ~Zone()

Destroy Zone instance.

ASMJIT_API void clear()

Free all allocated memory except first block that remains for reuse.

Note that this method will invalidate all instances using this memory allocated by this zone instance.

ASMJIT_API void reset()

Free all allocated memory at once.

Note that this method will invalidate all instances using this memory allocated by this zone instance.

size_t getChunkSize()

Get (default) chunk size.

void * alloc(size_t size)

Allocate size bytes of memory.

Pointer allocated by this way will be valid until Zone object is destroyed. To create class by this way use placement new and delete operators:

 // Example of simple class allocation.
 using namespace asmjit

 // Your class.
 class Object
 {
   // members...
 };

 // Your function
 void f()
 {
   // Create zone object with chunk size of 65536 bytes.
   Zone zone(65536);

   // Create your objects using zone object allocating, for example:
   Object* obj = new(zone.alloc(sizeof(YourClass))) Object();

   // ... lifetime of your objects ...

   // Destroy your objects:
   obj->~Object();

   // Zone destructor will free all memory allocated through it, you can
   // call @c zone.reset() if you wan't to reuse current @ref Zone.
 }

template < typename T >
T * allocT(size_t size = sizeof(T))

Like alloc(), but returns T*.
